snippet: The state’s highest court on Thursday cleared the way for New York City to issue up to 18,000 “hail licenses” for livery cabs throughout the five boroughs.
abstract: New York State Court of Appeals unanimously upholds Bloomberg administration's plan to radically expand street-hail taxi service beyond Manhattan, signaling fundamental shift in New York City's entrenched taxi culture; up to 18,000 newly designated taxis will begin operating in northern Manhattan and in other boroughs as early as July.
lead_paragraph: The state’s highest court on Thursday cleared the way for New York City to issue up to 18,000 “hail licenses” for livery cabs throughout the five boroughs.

headline.seo: Plan for Expanded Taxi-Hailing Service Reinstated
headline.main: Court Permits Hailing of Taxis Across the City
headline.print_headline: Court Permits Hailing of Taxis Across the City
